title: Motionless for Hours Symptom of Schizophrenia

content.question: Timothy, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, remains motionless for hours, no matter how awkward the position his body is in. What symptom is Timothy most clearly exhibiting?

choices.label: Catatonia, because catatonia is a condition in which a person's body remains in a rigid state.
Hallucinations, because he is probably seeing imaginary people telling him to remain still.
Delusions, because he probably is afraid that someone will attack him if he moves.
Flat affect, because he is experiencing a lack of emotions that causes him to remain so still.

content.answer: Catatonia, because catatonia is a condition in which a person's body remains in a rigid state.
